sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

![graph image](https://i.imgur.com/0tJG7NY.png)

Can you identify the perfect matching in this graph? If yes, provide the set of edges forming the perfect matching. If not, explain why no perfect matching exists.
message_2:
Yes, a perfect matching exists in this graph. A perfect matching is a set of edges such that every vertex is connected to exactly one edge in the set, and no two edges share a vertex.

The set of edges forming the perfect matching in this graph is:

{(A, D), (B, E), (C, F)}

This set of edges connects every vertex exactly once, and no two edges share a vertex.
